instruction: What are all the courses required to get a BS in Computer Science at Missouri State?
response:
To get a BS in Computer Science (CS Option), you must complete 120 total hours, including Core CS, Math, Science, and Elective courses.

**Core Computer Science (13 courses / 40 hours):**
• **CSC 130(3):** The World of Computer Science
• **CSC 131(4):** Computational Thinking
• **CSC 232(4):** Data Structures
• **CSC 244(3):** Computer Architecture
• **CSC 325(3):** Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures
• **CSC 333(2):** Lang. & Machines
• **CSC 335(3):** Database Systems Concepts
• **CSC 360(3):** Operating Systems
• **CSC 365(3):** Internet Programming
• **CSC 388(3):** Intro to Secure Computing
• **CSC 450(4):** Software Engineering
• **CSC 482(2):** Seminar in Computer Science
• **CSC 565(3):** Computer Networks

**Required Math (5 courses / 19 hours):**
• **MTH 261(5):** Calculus I
• **MTH 280(5):** Calculus II
• **MTH 314(3):** Discrete Mathematics
• **MTH 315(3):** Algebraic Structures
• **MTH 345(3) OR MTH 540(3):** Statistics OR Statistical Theory

**Required Science (2 courses):**
• **PHY 203(5) OR PHY 123(4):** Found. of Physics I OR Intro to Physics I
• **BIO 121(4) OR BMS 110(3):** (Biology or Biomedical Sciences)

**Other Requirements:**
• **9 hours** of approved CSC electives
• **General Education** courses
• **Exit Exam:** Pass the computer science major field test (MFT)

**Resources:**
Consult the official flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
This is a sample plan. You must meet with an advisor to map out your full remaining schedule and track your 120 total hours.

metadata.topic: BS Computer Science All Course Requirements (Missouri State)

instruction: List just the core CSC courses required for the Computer Science major at MSU.
response:
Here are the 13 core Computer Science (CSC) courses required for the BS in Computer Science (Computer Science Option):

• **CSC 130(3):** The World of Computer Science
• **CSC 131(4):** Computational Thinking
• **CSC 232(4):** Data Structures
• **CSC 244(3):** Computer Architecture
• **CSC 325(3):** Algorithms & Adv. Data Structures
• **CSC 333(2):** Lang. & Machines
• **CSC 335(3):** Database Systems Concepts
• **CSC 360(3):** Operating Systems
• **CSC 365(3):** Internet Programming
• **CSC 388(3):** Intro to Secure Computing
• **CSC 450(4):** Software Engineering
• **CSC 482(2):** Seminar in Computer Science
• **CSC 565(3):** Computer Networks

**Resources:**
These courses are all listed on the official department flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Remember that in addition to these 40 hours of core courses, you also need 9 hours of CSC electives, plus all Math, Science, and General Education requirements.

metadata.topic: BS Computer Science Core CSC Courses (Missouri State)

instruction: How many courses and credit hours do I need for the Computer Science major at Missouri State?
response:
You need a total of **120 credit hours** to graduate. The requirements for the Computer Science Option are broken down as follows:

• **Core CS:** 13 courses (totaling 40 credit hours)
• **Math:** 5 courses (totaling 19 credit hours)
• **Science:** 2 courses (totaling 7-9 credit hours)
• **CS Electives:** 9 credit hours (usually 3 courses)
• **General Education & Minor:** The remaining hours (approx. 45-47) are filled by your General Education requirements and a minor (the Math courses often fulfill the minor).

**Graduation Requirements:**
• **Total Hours:** 120
• **Upper-Division:** At least 40 hours must be 300-level or above.
• **Exit Exam:** You must pass the Major Field Test (MFT) with a 50th percentile or higher.

**Resources:**
See the official flowchart for the visual breakdown: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Use your C-APP degree audit in My Missouri State to track your progress toward these 120 hours.

metadata.topic: BS Computer Science Credit Hour Breakdown (Missouri State)

instruction: What are the math and science requirements for the BS in Computer Science at MSU?
response:
The BS in Computer Science has a strong math emphasis. You are required to complete the following 5 math courses and 2 science courses:

**Mathematics Requirements (5 courses):**
• **MTH 261(5):** Calculus I
• **MTH 280(5):** Calculus II
• **MTH 314(3):** Discrete Mathematics
• **MTH 315(3):** Algebraic Structures
• **MTH 345(3) OR MTH 540(3):** Statistics OR Statistical Theory

**Science Requirements (2 courses):**
• **Physics:** PHY 203(5) Found. of Physics I OR PHY 123(4) Intro to Physics I
• **Life Science:** BIO 121(4) OR BMS 110(3)

**Resources:**
These are listed on the official CS department flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Be sure to check the prerequisites for these courses. For example, MTH 261 is a prerequisite for MTH 280, and MTH 315 is a prerequisite for CSC 325.

metadata.topic: BS Computer Science Math and Science Requirements (Missouri State)

instruction: Can you give me a checklist of all requirements to graduate with a BS in Computer Science from Missouri State?
response:
Yes, here is a checklist of the main requirements for the BS in Computer Science (Computer Science Option).

**Graduation Checklist:**
• **Total Hours:** Complete at least 120 total credit hours.
• **Upper-Division Hours:** Complete at least 40 credit hours at the 300-level or above.
• **Core CS:** Complete all 13 required core CSC courses (CSC 130 through CSC 565).
• **Math:** Complete all 5 required MTH courses (MTH 261, 280, 314, 315, and 345/540).
• **Science:** Complete 1 Physics course and 1 Life Science course from the approved list.
• **Electives:** Complete 9 hours of approved CSC electives.
• **Minor:** Fulfill the requirements for a minor (the required math courses typically satisfy the Mathematics minor).
• **GenEd:** Complete all General Education requirements.
• **Exit Exam:** Pass the Computer Science Major Field Test (MFT) with at least a 50th percentile score.

**Resources:**
You can visualize these requirements on the CS flowchart: https://www.cs.missouristate.edu

**Next Steps:**
Use your C-APP degree audit on My Missouri State as your official checklist and meet with your advisor every semester to confirm you are on track.

metadata.topic: BS Computer Science Graduation Checklist (Missouri State)
